intro: Galearia helferi, commonly known as the Helfer's bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in Kazakhstan and the Tian Shan range. The plant is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes. Galearia helferi is a perennial herb that is relatively rare and has limited distribution in its native habitat.
